website_summaries.verdict: The journal for people who don't usually journal, with prompts to guide one's daily entries.
pros: Gives a topic when you don't know what to write about
Fun to watch answers change over time to track personal growth
cons: Tight binding means you have to hold it open while writing

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't really what I was expecting...
customer_reviews.text: It is a very beautiful book. The front and back are embossed in black lettering, the page edges are gold. Each day has one question that you answer for five years. So you will be answering the same question on April 18th for 5 years (just to clarify). You can see how your answers change every year without having to flip through a traditional journal. Not sure what I was expecting now but it may surprise me!
customer_reviews.author: Stephenie B.

customer_reviews.title: Great concept but fails a bit.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something I could record for next couple years and see if my responses would change. I have been an avid journaler for years. I do like the idea behind it. It asks an array of questions from what's your favorite quote to what did you eat that day. But some of the questions are really off or just odd to answer. Aside from that I do enjoy the journal. I just would have liked some more deep and personal questions rather than generalized questions.
customer_reviews.author: N87

customer_reviews.title: A fun way to check in with yourself.
customer_reviews.text: This has been really fun! I had been eyeing a few of these types of books for some time and decided to use Christmas money on it and begin January 1st. You could start any day, though. The questions are varied and often surprising. Only having a small space is also nice as I don't feel the need to overdo it and it doesn't become a burden. Also, it's the end of May and I'm still looking forward to writing in it each day; I even make a point of taking it when I travel I'm also looking forward to seeing how my answers change/don't change over time.
customer_reviews.author: Keri

customer_reviews.title: Cute, petite, shows progress
customer_reviews.text: This journal is smaller in size (about the size of my cell phone) than I expected, but that’s great because it’s easy to carry around. I wish I would have known about this my freshman year in college (almost 5 years ago). I graduated last year, and I did do full journaling most of my time in school (a page a day), but it’s hard to see the progress you made when you have to search through different books to find the date you’re looking for. This is an easier way to see the progress you make in life. If a lot can change in a day, imagine how much can change in five years!
customer_reviews.author: MyLynda S

customer_reviews.title: I saw this online (Buzzfeed) and thought it was a great idea! The quality is fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely darling!! I saw this online (Buzzfeed) and thought it was a great idea! The quality is fantastic! The gold leaf edges are beautifully done and the card stock used is perfect! Not too thin and not too thick. Overall construct of the book is exceptional. I've had it a few days now and am enjoying writing little statements to answer the questions. Very creative questions such as "What is the oldest thing you're wearing?". Something so silly, but short, sweet and to the point. Would make a wonderful gift to anyone at any age! I think I'll be buying the 3 year Relationship one next!
customer_reviews.author: Katri

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2, both arrived heavily damaged...
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY wanted to like this book as the concept is great and I bought two of them. Yet BOTH came damaged, one has large and obvious scratch marks ALL over the shiny part and the other has damage to the spine. From a visual perspective they look like trash and I don’t want to keep it around and have to look at it for 5 years... one was to be for my girlfriend and I’m not embarrassed to gift her either one of these.
customer_reviews.author: TDjuniord3

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I buy this for my friends on their birthdays. Great great great idea if one actually does it consistently. My mom did this book for three years straight before she passed away. It's the most coveted thing among our family as it shows a part of her that we wouldn't have known. Reading her entries also make us feel like she's still here. Seeing what a cool thing it was for her to do, I've been doing it now for three years and counting for my daughter! It's pretty too. I like the color and the gold leaf edging on the pages. Nicely made and a good price point.
customer_reviews.author: Abrots

customer_reviews.title: New favorite bedtime ritual
customer_reviews.text: I am not a journal person, never have been, but when I saw this journal I was intrigued by the idea. I'm a very sentimental person and love anniversaries and holidays. However, I always had too much to say when I wrote things down so it would come out very jumbled which is why I could never keep a journal for long. The Q&A a day journal I LOVE because it gives me a prompt! I love talking about myself so answering questions is right up my alley. Plus getting a 5 year record of daily thoughts and emotions is just too cool. I can't wait to see how much has changed in 1 year and then 5 years!
customer_reviews.author: ShelbyTop Contributor: Korean Beauty Products

customer_reviews.title: Great self care and gift!
customer_reviews.text: I needed something that will get me to sit down for five minutest to reflect and quiet down For "me time". Rather than getting a blank journal to stare at I got this a question a day and it has been great! I started to spend more time on other hobbies in my office after developing a habit to sit for a few minutes a day writing in this journal. I love it so much had already ordered two more as gifts for friends. It's the little things that makes the day. Looking forward to reading it in a few years to see how my life will change.
customer_reviews.author: R.T.H

customer_reviews.title: I love the concept and it's a great fun introspective little ...
customer_reviews.text: I received this book as a gift from a friend. I am almost completed the first year. I love the concept and it's a great fun introspective little book (journal). I like how some questions are hard (requires reflection) and some are easy but "telling of your life." I have recommended it to friends & bought some as gifts. It's an interesting way to see how you can change in 5 years. I did find some of the questions are really similar; the question asks the same thing in different ways. There are too many questions out there to have similar ones!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAficionado

customer_reviews.title: Dare to step out of box, sometimes.
customer_reviews.text: I am ordering my second book. I want to make sure I have a new one to start when I complete the entries in my current one. It is like chatting with an old friend every morning. My ritual is to complete the daily entry whilst having my morning coffee. I hide my previous answers so it doesn’t influence the current years comment. What fun to look back at the previous years answers. My answers tend to be so consistent, and it does help me to know I am so stable; but the journal also reveals when I should consider stepping out of my box. It gives me small pleasure every day.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce S

customer_reviews.title: Journal On!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting to start a journal for years. I would start and after a while, stop. I think it was because it allowed space for a lot of writing. This book allows enough room for a special thought for the day. I like that. I think I am on my way to journaling at last! Plus room for five years all in one place!
customer_reviews.author: Iviann

customer_reviews.title: Good for the ritualistic sentimentalist
customer_reviews.text: This isn't yet a year old for me so I haven't had the opportunity to look back at old answers, but I've enjoyed the daily ritual that this brings me. If you're someone who enjoys journaling daily, you'll find this mildly useful, as some of the questions can be open to interpretation and open the door to longer entries (you'll need a separate journal or piece of paper for that - there are only a few lines per day, per year; brevity is key). I like the heavier paper. The book is small and sturdy, definitely portable and could survive being carried around daily. I only wish it came with a ribbon to mark my place.
customer_reviews.author: Sloan

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this journal. I purchased one for myself and it's amazing! It takes only moments, and gives my day an introspective and relaxing end. I like that some of the questions are deeper, while others are more straightforward and to the point. I told my sisters about it and they loved the idea, so I bought one for two of my sisters. A third found out about it and begged me to get her one too. It is now a gift that I have purchased for a number of my good friends as well. I definitely recommend this journal!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: The actual product came in good condition, and the book is very nice. But after flipping through some of the questions, I just found it wasn't for me! It had many questions that just didn't seem fun to answer. I will be purchasing the kids version instead, as that seems like it will be more fun. EDIT: It turns out one of my friends really liked the questions in this one. Really this was just a personal dislike for the questions in this book. I gave this Q&A book to her, and now she writes in it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Tina W

customer_reviews.title: I'm so in love with it
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this journal about 30 minutes now and just in that short time (and filling in today's entry), I'm so in love with it. I'm having things going on in my life and I feel the need to write and sometimes, I just don't want to poor out my soul but still want to feel productive. I feel that this is something I will keep up with because it's just gorgeous to look at. But the prompts don't seem so, for lack of a better word, lame. Leafing through the pages, the questions are interesting but simple and I feel like I'm really going to enjoy filling them in and looking back on my answers as time goes on.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley G.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Journal Idea!
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautifully crafted journal for people tracking progress and trying to remember to write everyday on a daily basis. It's quality of material is gorgeous. The pages are sprayed with a golden frame. The questions are pretty neat and the fact you do this over five years is a huge undertaking. However, it's not that big of a commitment as the questions are fairly simple and stuff you probably ask yourself at night when you can't sleep anyway. Very durable little journal you can take anywhere. I bet it will be satisfying to complete five full years. Super cool present gift or journal idea. Totally recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: Missy K.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great until cover wears away
customer_reviews.text: I first got one of these eight or so years ago, and bought another once I finished that one, almost three and a half years ago. The first one still looks great, even after using daily for five years. With this one, though, the edge of the cover, along the spine, is fraying and comping apart. I don't think I've treated this one any differently, so I wonder if the manufacturer changed the materials to something cheaper. It obviously doesn't last as long, and after another year and a half of use, I anticipate that this one will look considerably worse than my first.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan S.

customer_reviews.title: High quality journal to document 5 years memories.
customer_reviews.text: Love this journal so much! It prompts me with different questions daily and I always insert a bit of context of current happenings that day. It’s short and sweet, not overwhelming. I received it as a Christmas gift last year and have been journaling all year. Year 2 starts in a few days! Can’t wait to see how 5 years look. The book is high quality with thick paper and beautiful gold sides. I got it for my friendS as a gift this year with a few pretty pens for her to write with. This is her pic of it.
customer_reviews.author: Q N.

customer_reviews.title: Really nice journal/book
customer_reviews.text: This journal is sturdy, well made, and looks like an actual book. The edges of the pages are metallic gold, and the front/back are hard and sturdy. Each day gives a good amount of space to write a short answer, and the questions are thought provoking. I wondered how there would be enough questions for a full year, but this is well done. Some of the questions it asks may seem mundane ("How did you get to work today"), but they will be interesting to track over 5 years. I recommend this journal for those who want to journal, but never find the time. Each day is short and sweet.
customer_reviews.author: Dan G.

customer_reviews.title: This is a brilliant product. I love the format - being able ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a brilliant product. I love the format - being able to answer each question several years in a row will be a cool way of seeing how my thoughts and ideas change over time. The questions aren't mundane or redundant, and even though it's designed to elicit short, concise answers, there's plenty of space to write in each entry. I look forward to writing in this every day, and I bought one to gift to a good friend who equally loves it.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: but this is perfect to just jot down what I did each day
customer_reviews.text: This is the 6th year I've kept this little journal. There isn't enough room to write down all my thoughts and feelings, but this is perfect to just jot down what I did each day. I can't tell you how many times I've gone back to look something up (when were we in London? when did Uncle Joe die?). It's an excellent daily habit - I do it with breakfast. It has some interesting little prompts, but I don't use them much. I use different colors for each year.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: A no pressure journal
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been writing in this for slightly over a year, and I can already see the difference in just the past year. It’s really nice to see how things have changed since last year and see that maybe life isn’t as bad as I was feeling it was last year when I was single and miserable. Also it can be pretty funny to read your own stupid or snarky answers. On the plus side it’s super quick so you don’t feel like you have to set aside a chunk of time, just jot down a sentence right before bed.
customer_reviews.author: Fratib

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I have a hard time writing daily in a journal. When I saw this just had a short daily entry and some questions to help give some inspiration I thought it was something I could do. I also really liked the idea of being able to look back over the years. Some of the questions can be goofy, but I can change it to something else or just get very creative with my answer. The book is great quality. I'm sure after five years it will look a bit rougher, but I'm certain if will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: lh09

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: A cute little book, I personally find it hard to journal everyday but if you are inclined to do so this is definitely a must-have daily notebook. The pages are a bit small so on days with more compelling topics you will have to either cram or really cut down your response for some days. Although you may be able to take a 4X6 notecard and continue writing on that if you need more room, just remember to jot down the year you wrote it.
customer_reviews.author: Haylee

customer_reviews.title: Neat idea but not my kind of style
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited for this but I can't say the questions excite me. I think some of them try to get really philosophical. I didn't want a serious journal where I try to write deep thoughts on a couple lines. I like the questions that are fun and/or about some mundane thing that happened that day to trigger a memory. There are some sprinkled throughout the book but I decided I'll likely give mine away (I never actually wrote in it).
customer_reviews.author: leex

customer_reviews.title: Too Cute!
customer_reviews.text: This book is small enough to ride along with you on vacation or to hide from nosey brothers and sisters. ;) I ordered three. One for my niece Chelsia, sister Cashea, and one for me. I'm going to give them as Christmas presents for an "Aunt & Niece" thing. I like the journal gives you a few lines to explain your answers.
customer_reviews.author: olivia chenell rigney

customer_reviews.title: Looking forward to many years with this journal!
customer_reviews.text: I'm terrible at journaling. The idea has always intrigued me and I've tried keeping a journal several times, but it never seems to last longer than a few days. Being a busy professional, it's not something I have time to pursue, so this Q&A journal is perfect: one question, a minute or two of thought, one writtten line and I'm done! It will be fun to see how my answers change as the years pass.
customer_reviews.author: HVDH

customer_reviews.title: This book is so adorable and perfect for what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This book is so adorable and perfect for what I was looking for. It's smaller than what I thought, it's about the size of my hand. Which is fine. The pages are gold trimmed and the book has a old rustic kind of look to it. I just love it. The questions vary and mixes things up every day. It's great to look back at what your answer was a year ago. It's a great way to see how things have progressed. I would definitely purchase this book again.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie A Burke

customer_reviews.title: How Will Your Life Change in 5 Years?
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this book! I have given it as a gift to many of my friends and I finally bought a copy for myself. It is such a neat way to track your life over the course of five years! I mean, a ton can happen in five years and I can't wait to see how I saw things now, five years from now. I does make a fantastic birthday or holiday gift; in times that mark a milestone or special event, this is the perfect gift! It is a veristile enough gift to give to your best friend, your mom, or an acquaintance for whom you have no idea what to get! Definitely worth a try!!
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine Em

customer_reviews.title: THE PERFECT GIFT!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for myself and have gifted them twice! These are such a fun way to keep track of the years, and perfect for someone who doesn't have the time to fully journal! I am on my fifth year and getting to look back on how times have changed (or haven't) is just incredible! Sometimes the questions don't quite apply to me, so there are a few where I have written my own questions! It is so fun!!!
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Money
customer_reviews.text: The format of this book is flawed. Each page , headed by a less-than-thought-provoking question, has a few lines for each of five years’ entries. So you get to answer the same question on the same day for five years in a row. Boring and uncreative at best. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love how each day gives you one little question to ponder; some are kind of silly and some require more reflection. But the journal is a fun way to capture your mindset at the moment, and it'll be interesting to see how that mindset changes (or not) over the next few years. Highly recommend! **Just bought another one for my niece who is turning 30. What a great way to start your 30th birthday!
customer_reviews.author: A Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift Idea
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a work white elephant exchange. Person who received it loved it. Book is decent quality. It was a lot smaller than I imagined when purchased, but no biggie it was plenty big to write All needed things in. It's pocket book sized, but much thicker. Weird quirk though, the cover of the book was applied upside down to the pages inside the book, again not a big deal as it still functions properly, but hit my minor OCD nerve inside. Thought it was a cute gift idea!
customer_reviews.author: Work hard, play hard.

customer_reviews.title: Small in size but so far great in reflecting
customer_reviews.text: I have thought about buying this book for about four years. As a teacher returning to the classroom during COVID I wanted a little thing to write down some memories that were not the same thing everyday. So far this has been great. It is a fun way to end the day and has interesting questions. It is small, so be aware of that when purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Ison

customer_reviews.title: Taking me longer than 5 years and I still love it.
customer_reviews.text: Taking longer than 5 years is ok too. I’m not as diligent journalist. I can go a year without touching it. I bought it in 2013 I think and I’m still filling some pages at the second or third entry. I will fill out a week in the past when I sit down but the purpose is the same. A window in my life and the ways I’ve changed.
customer_reviews.author: mapleleafmomof3

customer_reviews.title: Really Cool
customer_reviews.text: This book is so fun. I'm on year two, although I skipped a lot because I have trouble remembering. I love to see how things have changed from last year. The questions are really good, you can tell the authors put a lot of thought into them. I would recommend it for anyone who has trouble coming up with journal ideas and works well with journal prompts. The spaces are small, so it is also a great choice if you don't have a lot of time to journal. I highly recommend this for people like me - forgetful about journaling, not enough time to write huge entries, easier to respond to prompts than to write freely.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of my most treasured posesssions!
customer_reviews.text: I've gifted this journal to many friends over the years, but started my own in 2018. It's been about 2.5 years now, and I can honestly say it's one of my most favorite routines every night before bed. My one suggestion is having an online version with the question prompts so that when you travel you don't miss any days, but I've made one for myself by typing out all the questions and keeping it on file for myself to fill out when I get home. I highly recommend, and hope to continue using this journal throughout my life.
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: Q&A makes my day!
customer_reviews.text: The Q&A journal is a cool and simple way to get a person thinking. With questions such as 'What was the last tv show you watched?,' this item makes it fun to think of how tastes might change from year-to-year. I usually struggle with opening a standard journal, only to be met by a blank page; I never know how to start.
customer_reviews.author: H. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Good things come in small packages!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little book! I'm a busy mom, so doing any kind of full-on journaling is just not an option for me, but this little book is the perfect approach for someone who enjoys the idea of documenting life but is so busy living it they can't spend a lot of time! I love the design of the book, very beautifully done and I especially love that the pages are in the thicker side. Not cheaply made at all. My daughters both have requested one of their own, now!
customer_reviews.author: Alden Stowe

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Easy
customer_reviews.text: I really like this 5 year journal. The daily questions are easy enough to get me thinking without overthinking. The binding and overall quality is wonderful. While maybe not an heirloom, this will last through passing down to grandchildren if you wanted. A good way to start my morning, quick and insightful.
customer_reviews.author: Melaina Lara

customer_reviews.title: Change Will Happen!
customer_reviews.text: OH MY GOSH!!! I am thoroughly enjoying this book, it is on the small side, no bigger than your entire hand from finger to bottom of your palm. The prompts are wonderful and I believe the small lines and spacing makes you really think and get right to the point. I'm excited to see how my answers change since I'm 21 now to 2022 when I turn 25!
customer_reviews.author: Janae Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Love This!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Q&A journal for myself, five family members, and one wonderful friend and each of us are delighted! With just enough room for a short answer, the journals are quick and simple to write in (and - guilty admission - also easy to catch up on should one fall behind!) A wonderful, small gift for a friend or yourself! I've shopped quite lot on Amazon for years, and have always relied on reviews to help in my decisions - so please know all my reviews are entirely straightforward! If you have any questions feel free to ask.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Taylor

customer_reviews.title: If you aren't good at journaling, this is the book for you!
customer_reviews.text: I am literally so terrible at journaling, remembering to journal, and/or thinking about what to journal. But this book has made it SO easy for me to record moments of the last five years of my life in such a fun way! The book is very sturdy and has been with me to two foreign countries! It is small and petite, but it encourages you to keep your answers short and sweet~ I can't recommend this journal enough! Why not take like $15 out of your budget to invest in a book you will use for 5 years?! Just go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Great questions fun journal
customer_reviews.text: I love this journal it has great questions and I can’t wait to see how the answers will change in the years it really is like a time capsule my only complaint would be I wish I had more space to write and maybe it be a larger book only because I have big bubble hand writing other then that I absolutely love it
customer_reviews.author: Sweetkiller

customer_reviews.title: Good for the lazy ones
customer_reviews.text: I have been woefully neglectful of journaling all my life, despite the benefits of watching yourself grow and change via the pages of journals. This one is perfect for lazy, forgetful people like myself. This journal gives users about 4 lines to write their response to each question (perfect for those filling it in just before bed, when too tired to write pages upon pages). The questions are sometimes funny, sometimes deep. It will be interesting to look back at it over the five years of its lifetime to see how I've changed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but I also like that on the inevitable days I don't feel like ...
customer_reviews.text: Just a few days in and i'm already loving it. It is VERY small so there is not a lot of room to write, but I also like that on the inevitable days I don't feel like soul searching I can answer the simple question quickly. There is a nice variety of questions as well- without looking forward too much, I found a range from thought-provoking to making me have to review my credit cards transactions to looking in my fridge :) This is definitely not for serious journal keepers, but I think it makes a great daily "Me" moment and this will be my go-to gift for people who are difficult to shop for.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi B.

customer_reviews.title: I love the little topics it gives you to write each ...
customer_reviews.text: I always wanted to keep a personal journal but I always forget after 3-4 days of writing in one because I ran out of things to write about. I've only started this journal but its the longest I've actually maintained writing! I love the little topics it gives you to write each day so I never run out of things to talk about/ I look forward to end of each night just so I can write in a new entry for the day. This will be fun look back upon once I fill this out for 5 years and compare my personal growth.
customer_reviews.author: cydar

customer_reviews.title: Self Care in no time
customer_reviews.text: I'm a graduate student, losing my mind with no time to take care of myself. I had this in my wish list for the longest time and got it for Christmas. It's great! I really love it-- the questions range from very insightful to goofy and random. You can answer the daily question in no time. To make it better, even if you forget or don't have time to write in it for a few days it never takes more than 15 minutes to get caught back up. Two thumbs up, I would definitely buy again or as a gift
customer_reviews.author: Constructive_Criticism87

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for your average squirrel
customer_reviews.text: I always want to journal but I squirrel A LOT (get side tracked) this is perfect, yeah some questions are a little... ehh... but if I forget a day or two the majority of questions I can still answer late and it still be true, but not so run of the mill that my answers couldnt possibly different in a yr making it interesting to see your mindset year by year. (Example; what was the main headline for today and your thoughts. If you could change anything about today what would it be. Ect....)
customer_reviews.author: susan lewis

customer_reviews.title: GREAT QUALITY JOURNAL  FOR SHORT AND SWEET ENTRIES
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Q & A journal. It is made to be used for five consecutive years. I use it to cover five categories each day and it has worked great for my needs. It is very high quality. I have never had an issue with the spine, gilding, or paper quality. I glue a ribbon to the back of mine, to have a pretty page marker.
customer_reviews.author: HAPPYMAMA

customer_reviews.title: Great little journal for those who do NOT like to journal!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little book!! I gave this as a gift to some high school graduates, and they also love it. I kept one for myself, leave it on my nightstand and do it almost every night, but it's easy to catch up on a night or 2 as well. I don't "journal" and I never will, but this is a great way to prompt a short writing and focus on the day, but also to reflect on the past as the years go on.
customer_reviews.author: Mom, wife, sister, human

customer_reviews.title: This item is too small to be a serious Life Journal
customer_reviews.text: I don’t remember ordering the journal, I might have added it to my cart when I had a large order. Returning it will cost me $5 but I might as well since I don’t have any use for it and would be too embarrassed to give this tiny journal to anyone I care for. It’s no bigger than my hand! How can this be a serious journal?
customer_reviews.author: molsby

customer_reviews.title: Came exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: I saw a friend using this journal and immediately ordered one. This beautiful, little book came exactly as pictured, and I love the gold shine on the pages. The writing prompts for each day aren't corny and contain a variety of subjects, from "what art movement best describes you?" to "what did you need more of today?" Highly recommend this book for anyone who has trouble keeping a regular journal... or just doesn't have time to write very much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five stars.
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this I personally didn’t want to write in it but instead use a separate journal so you can reuse the writing prompts for years to come. I am 100% a journaler. Writing helps me feel better and this book definitely did that for me. The prompts are great and could have you writing for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful journal
customer_reviews.text: What a great concept to make entries once a day over the course of five years. You get to go back and see how your life and you have changed within those five years. The questions are a variety of fun things and thought provoking subjects. I have really enjoyed using this journal.
customer_reviews.author: Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Adorable
customer_reviews.text: I want to write diary to keep track of the changes in myself, yet I don't want to write it long and have difficulty trying to find a topic. In my case, this is an awesome product since it has questions and only 4 lines for each answer. It shipped much faster than I expected, which is a major plus. The design and paper quality is excellent. The size is smaller than I expected, but it is convenient if you want to bring it when travelling.
customer_reviews.author: Anguyen

customer_reviews.title: Big enough and room to write
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I read all the reviews after I purchased this and before it arrived. It came today. After reading the reviews I expected an exceptionally small book with no room to write. It is a small book but, that is clearly shown when you order it. There is enough room to write a few sentences and that is what was stated upon order. I used it for the first time today and I loved it. And the sticker on the back peeled right off and my book started with Jan 1 and it was right side up.
customer_reviews.author: Figgy08

customer_reviews.title: A journal for the good intended but lazy!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been trying to journal my entire life and have always failed until I purchased this. It is easy to do everyday and even if you skip a couple of days you can catch up in minutes. I wish it was bigger though so I’m docking a star. Can be sort of tricky to write in if you have big handwriting. I purchased the version for mother’s as a baby shower gift and it had a ribbon bookmark. This one doesn’t, I wish it did. Otherwise, I love it!
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.text: It's been a lot of fun, I've had it almost 3 months now and while there's a couple 'eh' questions I've been wanting to purchase this for years and it definitely was worth buying it after all this time. I don't look ahead so each day I get to look forward to seeing a new prompt. :)
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Very fun way to journal.
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for me and my friend. Great questions. Super random! I’m terrible at journaling but this made it easier as I didn’t have to think about what to write, just answer the question. I love the aesthetic of the book but wish it was bigger. I can’t write much on the few lines it provides for each day and each question. Overall good.
customer_reviews.author: shantelle

customer_reviews.title: Great Book! Look forward to answering the questions each day!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality book. I look forward to writing in it everyday and can't wait to see the changes over the years! I originally bought one as a gift that needed a theme of "calendar" since I thought it was a cool twist on a traditional calendar. I loved it so much I bought a second one for myself! I also bought the couples one for me and my hubby- which I LOVE. IN both books the questions range from funny, weird, and serious. Really love these!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey587

customer_reviews.title: Its cool because you can compare your answers and see how ...
customer_reviews.text: The journal was a lot shorter than i imagined (as in height) and the layout was different than i thought. Each page is dedicated to a day of the year and has a question on the top with 5 places to answer it. So over the next 5 years when you journal for the day that day will always be on the same page for the next few years. Its cool because you can compare your answers and see how much you've changed without changing the page.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Loved it so much, started giving it as gifts
customer_reviews.text: I love this so much I started adding it to all my friends birthday gifts. It's a neat little book to jot down the answer to a daily question. I found the answer space more than adequate. It's not a diary. It asks you a daily question (ex. 'who would you like to have dinner with? or 'are you procrastinating?') and you respond. Over the course of 5 years, you'll revisit the questions and see how your answers have changed. It's a delightful little book.
customer_reviews.author: Shop-Til-You-Drop

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: I used this journal all last year, and sadly found it just wasn't appropriate to my life as it is now and in the future. Too many prompts didn't apply at all, and some seemed a bit condescending. In any case, I transitioned to a one-a-day Jane Austen quotation journal this year, and so far like it much better.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Sloop

customer_reviews.title: Fun little journal
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is excited about starting this journal. The questions are varied, and I think it will be fun for her to look back at her past answers as the years progress. The book is small, so it's not going to take up here entire nightstand, and it will travel well for times when she's away from home.
customer_reviews.author: Kbuck6

customer_reviews.title: BEST Journal for the Journal-Challenged
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE LOVE LOVE this journal. As a kid, I always wanted to be the kind of girl to keep a detailed log of my day-to-day doings. Unfortunately, I’m terrible at sticking to routines and rituals so I could never make it past the first entry in a regular diary. This is PERFECT for me because the prompts are specific enough to really get me thinking, yet I’m not intimidated by a bunch of blank space. I so look forward to filling out each day’s entry every day before bed... and for the first time in my life I’ve been able to commit to a daily activity! Only took 28 years to figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: oh_bshoppin

customer_reviews.title: Great and Easy Journal to Use
customer_reviews.text: I've enjoyed writing in this every night. I have never been a journaler, but this is so easy and quick to write in, that I think I'll stick with it. The premise - of seeing how your answers change from year to year - gives me incentive to keep going. For anyone who is confused, I thought I would be getting more of a softcover version, but it feels like a hard cover. I think it's more like a hard paperboard, but I like it, and think it will be durable. It's much nicer looking in person than I thought it would be. I plan on ordering a few of these for family members next Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth R.

customer_reviews.title: Makes an outstanding gift for new high school or college student
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend writes in this journal every night before bed. No matter how tired she is, the questions are so simple and easy that it isn't hard to answer. She's on her second year now and loves seeing what she wrote for the same question a year earlier -- for better and worse! We liked it so much that we bought one as a gift my niece who is entering 9th grade. With 5 years of responses, she'll be able to look back as a college student to how she answered questions like, "What's your favorite song today?" and questions about goals and dreams. The gold foil edging is a nice touch -- this looks really chic and elegant.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Tabor

customer_reviews.title: Overall great journal
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this journal. I've been trying to keep a journal for years and I never know what to write about. I really like the prompts that it gives you. I think it's really great to see how your responses change over five years. My mum really liked this journal so I ordered her one too! My only complaint is that it can be a little hard to write in due to a combination of the stiff spine and small size of the nook
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Great if you like to journal but don't know what to write
customer_reviews.text: I never have enough time to write out these long, journal posts, and this is a cute way to reflect on my day. I also love that you can re-answer the same question on the same day for 5 years. I look forward to filling out the answers next year and looking back at what I wrote the previous year to compare! Really neat idea, and I think this could make a cute, inexpensive gift as well!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Niemiec

customer_reviews.title: So worth it
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for almost a year now and absolutely love filling it out every day!! Each question is super different and interesting, takes literally less than 30 seconds to answer and I'm so excited to fill up the whole book and be able to look back at my answers as the years go on
customer_reviews.author: Lily H.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Book
customer_reviews.text: Awesome book!! I love filling it in everyday because the questions don't require some long, drawn-out response. My mom also bought one and she thought the letters were too small so she has trouble writing in it but hopefully she will keep using it. How cool is it going to be to look back at it every year?! And I LOVE the gold pages.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Cuteness
customer_reviews.text: This is a super cute book. It asks questions for each day... You can answer them for 5yrs in a row. Bought it for my bf for valentine's day. We both really look forward to answering them every night. The book itself is on the smaller scale but not tiny.
customer_reviews.author: MissyLynnMich

customer_reviews.title: Really fun for yourself or to do as a couple/family
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are answering these questions daily together. Cute little questions that we will really enjoy seeing the answers to for years to come. I travel for work and bring this little book with me and we discuss the questions over the phone while I am on the road. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Deming

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and when I opened it it was used. How can a diary be used?
customer_reviews.author: fayda ahmed

customer_reviews.title: A perfect gift for yourself or others
customer_reviews.text: I love this book so much. It's great for those too busy to write lengthy journal entries, and super easy to maintain daily with the pre-printed dates (years are completed by you). Love the overall quality of the construction, binding, gold gilded pages...even the 365 questions, which range from mundane to thought-provoking but all will be fun to read back in years to come. I've bought several of these and regardless of the recipient, are always appreciated and utilized.
customer_reviews.author: hawaiianpapaya

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this little journal. I am bummed I lost it in my move. I will be getting another one for 2019. I love writing down just a small sentence or two, and the questions are really awesome. If I ever find my other one I will have to compare my answers! I have recommended to a few friends.
customer_reviews.author: Krisy1989

customer_reviews.title: Such a Fun and Novel Idea!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter for her up-coming birthday. I flipped through it and love the concept. There is a daily question with room to write an answer on the same page for five consecutive years. I know she will enjoy putting pen to paper and looking back at her answers as time goes on.
customer_reviews.author: Baird-Greene

customer_reviews.title: This is a fun and easy way to have a record of your ...
customer_reviews.text: I've tried to journal before and just never could get going with it. This is a fun and easy way to have a record of your thoughts over the years. Just go with your first thought to each question. The questions also have made for great conversation starters with friends. I bought two for gifts for friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome daily journal
customer_reviews.text: Adding this journal to my daily/nightly routine has been such a great way to reflect! The questions range in focus, intent, seriousness, etc. One day it's "What's the oldest thing you wore today" to "Do you think people can change". I can't wait to compare answers over the years. The small spaces force you to keep your entries succinct. I echo other reviewers, however, that the book would be even better if it was a little bigger. It can be very awkward to write, especially if you need to catch up on multiple days or get toward the bottom of the page over the years. I hope newer editions expand in size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great inspiration to write a sentence or two per day
customer_reviews.text: Great inspiration to write a sentence or two per day. I wish it had a built in bookmark though, it’s hard to keep track of where I am and I end up flipping through each time to find the date. Once I buy a bookmark it’ll be better, just wish it had one of those cloth attached markers. Otherwise great journal, clever idea!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: High quality paper prevents bleed through, questions are thought provoking but easy and the amount of space is perfect for a quick response. I love that it has space to write the year, I think it’ll be so interesting to look back at how things change.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Very cool concept
customer_reviews.text: I'm very excited to start writing in the journal. A little smaller then I was hoping, but the size does make it portable so if I'm traveling it won't be such a hassel to take with me . The one thing I wish it had was a page keeper. Like a little string or something to help with finding what page you are on, but other than that it is very cool!
customer_reviews.author: lmv213

customer_reviews.title: Love this idea!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I decided to purchase this because I'm 25 now and have really been thinking about life in general. I thought this was a really neat concept, to see how much my life may change in the next 5 years. The book is nice material and I like the smaller size. It still gives enough room to answer questions. The book is pretty, too, which is nice. I'm excited to look it over in 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect "diary"
customer_reviews.text: . . . but it's not your traditional diary. It's one of two books I go for first thing when I get up. It is absolutely unique, provides questions for each day that lead you to think deeply about your life--present, past and future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Cover, Flimsy Pages that Arrived Bent
customer_reviews.text: This book arrived with many bent pages and fairly dusty. The content is fun, the concept is great, and the cover is beautiful. I am certain that had an undamaged book arrived, I would have rated it with more stars. Luckily I ordered it earlier enough to flatten out the pages and clean it before giving it as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Straka

customer_reviews.title: Cool to look back on
customer_reviews.text: I'm currently filling out the third year in this book; it's really cool to look back on what you were doing a couple years ago and since it only gives you about 4 lines per entry it makes it pretty easy to keep up with. Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Lacy

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I got this for myself last year and have used it for almost a year at this point. I really love it. There's enough room to write a pretty good amount for each prompt and the questions are very interesting.
customer_reviews.author: JillPill

customer_reviews.title: Cute and little
customer_reviews.text: This is such a cute little journal. The only negative thing I have to say about it, is the fact it's slightly smaller than I imagined. I didn't realize it was only about the size of my hand. I agree with other comments about the binding being tight but the more you use it, the more flexible it'll become. Happy with my purchase and would encourage others who want to journal but find they don't have the time that this is a great starting point :)
customer_reviews.author: Fortenberry's

customer_reviews.title: I like it. It asks a simple question each day
customer_reviews.text: I like it. It asks a simple question each day, kind of random. Sometimes its not an issue, but a couple of times I wished I had more lines to answer. To cover 5 years, i see why they squeezed it all in so the book would not be too thick. It looks nice and elegant. Gold page edges add a nice touch. Im curious to see that I stick with it over the course of 5 years and how my answers will differ from year to year.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria A

customer_reviews.title: What an excellent idea!
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Has lovely gilted edges. I think the book could benefit from being larger, maybe have 8.5" x 11" pages. It would allow more room for writing, as well as make the book less bulky. It's rather "stocky" as is, but is a lovely, high-quality product with thoughtful prompts. What an excellent idea!
customer_reviews.author: AnaSnow

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoy writing in this book every night
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy writing in this book every night. Takes a minute. Its very cute and will last 5 years. Goes with my french chic decor too.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful little journal.
customer_reviews.text: I love this little journal! I have one for myself and gave one as a gift. I look forward to reading my daily entries in the years to come. Will they reflect the inevitable changes in my life from year to year? We will see!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Cool!
customer_reviews.text: This is such an awesome idea! I absolutely love it! Of course, I forget to answer the questions sometimes for a few days in a row, but that's what makes it kind of fun! It goes something like, "As usual, I forgot to answer the questions for the last four days but today my answer is...." Hopefully in 5 years I will have the self discipline and structure to have it done daily...it will be interesting to see how my life evolves ...or doesn't haha! :)
customer_reviews.author: Christy Duke

customer_reviews.title: Awesome journal option
customer_reviews.text: Awesome journal option. I've struggled to keep a journal my entire life. Always wanting to, but never taking the time and being too lazy. This one is pretty short and easy to update each day with particular but open-ended questions each day. You can do it as you remember, so there's not too much obligation or expectation. I do wish there was a little more space for the entries to elaborate more, but then that would just fall into the endeavor category that I've always put journals into in my mind and then I wouldn't do it. So, this is a great compromise to start getting into journaling.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Rust

customer_reviews.title: I got two of these
customer_reviews.text: Both were for Christmas presents. The girls are both preteens and I like the idea that they need only write a sentence or two for each entry. Each entry will be on one page for 5 years. It should be fun for them to look back each year and then when they are old it will be even better.
customer_reviews.author: OAH

customer_reviews.title: thus a 3-star rating (would liked to have rated it 3 1/2 stars)
customer_reviews.text: This question journal is too small and doesn't have a ribbon bookmark, thus a 3-star rating (would liked to have rated it 3 1/2 stars). There just isn't a lot of room to write your answers, to really explore them rather than just simply jotting down a short answer. Looks like it has some really good questions. It's a great concept for creating a time capsule, where you can compare a particular day with that day from the previous years.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi L.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: My journaling seemed to be fizzling out so I bought this to get me focused again. It does have some very interesting questions that make you "scratch your head and say, 'HMMM'" That's probably why I like it. As other reviews have said, though, it is very small with not much space in which to answer the prompts, but they ARE just prompts. I will carry-over any extended answers in my full-sized journal. This one would be perfect for someone who has trouble getting started in creative writing.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Fun way to journal!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a fun way to record your thoughts daily. The book offers different questions for 365 days...with 5 spaces beneath each question for you to record your answer for 5 years. I like the various questions, and it's interesting to see what I wrote the previous year. I used to write lengthy journal entries with no real topic, so this helps me to be quick and to the point. It's kind of like a real life twitter account for your daily thoughts...because there's really not enough space to write more than a sentence or two. This would be a great gift for people who enjoy books or writing...it helps to think of a new question each day!
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn F
